author: hsaito
body:
## Steps to reproduce
1. Start Powershell
2. Prompt is displayed
3. Type in Find-Command
4. A segmentation fault occurs
## Expected behavior

It should not cause a segmentation fault, and should display a list of commands.

strace below:

```
PS /home/hideki>                           Find-Command                                                                                                                                               
) = 0
futex(0x93c188, FUTEX_WAKE_PRIVATE, 1)  = 0
gettid()                                = 28897
clone(child_stack=0x7f74317b8fb0, flags=CLONE_VM|CLONE_FS|CLONE_FILES|CLONE_SIGHAND|CLONE_THREAD|CLONE_SYSVSEM|CLONE_SETTLS|CLONE_PARENT_SETTID|CLONE_CHILD_CLEARTID, parent_tidptr=0x7f74317b99d0, tls=0x7f74317b9700, child_tidptr=0x7f74317b99d0) = 28917
sched_getparam(28917, [0])              = 0
sched_getscheduler(28917)               = 0 (SCHED_OTHER)
sched_get_priority_max(SCHED_OTHER)     = 0
sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_OTHER)     = 0
sched_setscheduler(28917, SCHED_OTHER, [0]) = 0
write(168, "*", 1)                      = 1
sched_yield()                           = 0
sched_yield()                           = 0
sched_yield()                           = 0
futex(0x93c1b4, FUTEX_WAIT_PRIVATE, 9, NULL <unfinished ...>
+++ killed by SIGSEGV +++
zsh: segmentation fault  strace powershell
```
## Actual behavior

Powershell segfaults and does not display a list of commands.
## Environment data

```

WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                                                                                                   
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                                                   
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1     
```

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Hi hsaito!

You missed to provide which version of linux you had this issue.

I did ran Find-Command on my Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS Desktop and had no problems executing the Find-Command in PowerShell version v6.0.0-alpha.10.

![posh6findcmd](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/18818859/bb47e4dc-8352-11e6-8b0f-9cc2e31bf35f.png)
. (see image)

comments.author: hsaito
comments.body:
Sorry for the lack of info on that, it's ubuntu 16.04 LTS, 15.6GiB memory, Intel Core i7-2600 CPU @ 340GHz x 8, Gallium 0.4 and AMD TURKS (DRM 2.43.0, LLVM 3.8.0).

I have actually isolated this issue to only happen when I am connected through VPN. If I disconnect from the VPN (OpenVPN -- I can't provide too much detail about its connection due to security issues), it works as designed.

Also noted other commands like Find-Package seems to work over VPN, however observing consistent failure for Find-Command.
